column4: anyone know off the top of their head which shell will autocomplete previous commands?  ie:  type 'mys' then hit the up arrow and have it find the last command you typed starting with 'mys' ?
could always use: history | grep mys | tail -n 1     ;)
hehe I could but I had a server where I could literally just type 'mys' and hit the up arrow and it would search my history for me and autocomplete the string
not heard of that myself, you could even script it and replace mys with $1
